originalText.text: My first time taking the LSAT I scored a 136. I was sad and defeated but I knew I wanted to do better. I decided to go online, find a tutor, and that’s how I found Milan and Total LSAT Prep. His curriculum made sense and his personable demeanor made asking questions an enjoyable experience. By the time the November 2021 LSAT came around I felt confident since Milan had me taking practice tests in a similar environment. I received a 162 on that LSAT, a 26 point increase WOW. I am now going to law school on scholarship. Thank you Milan and Total LSAT Prep!

originalText.text: I came to Milan about 1 month from my first LSAT attempt just to strengthen the fundamentals I had built leading up to that point. Taking his course and having one-one-one tutoring sessions allowed me to start receiving higher practice test scores right away. With Milan's help I was able to achieve a score that I did not know was possible for myself. I highly recommend Total LSAT prep along with Milan's help to anyone looking to take the LSAT!

originalText.text: Milan and I did tutor sessions from late December of 2017 to January of 2018, I believe. What attracted me to booking with Milan was his bio. He appeared very knowledgeable as an LSAT tutor and I received just that.  He is serious, professional, and good at what he does. I had rough days while he was my tutor, this was not a bad thing. I needed to be uncomfortable so I could grow as a student and pass that LSAT.  Milan will make sure you understand and try multiple avenues to achieve that. I am TERRIBLE at test taking, however, with his help and my due diligence I received a 152 as my LSAT score. I know it's pretty average but knowing how I take tests and learn it was difficult and achieving that score the first time around I was thrilled. I learned so much about myself and how I retain information  while having a tutor. I am thankful for Milan. He does good work and has great experience.  If you need to up your level in the LSAT or need understanding- please consider Milan.

originalText.text: Milan was an Excellent LSAT tutor! I primarily started taking lessons to boost my score on the logic games. Milan made that section much more accessible than any of the LSAT books that I was using at the time for self-study (Powerscore, Manhattan LSAT, etc.). I’ve boosted my LSAT score by about 12 points using his pointers for the logic games and a couple of other sections. I ultimately only missed two questions in that section. Taking lessons with him was ultimately one of my best investments into my career. I was ultimately able to get into one of my top law schools with a merit scholarship, and I’m currently working in the type of work that I am interested in. Thank you so much, Milan!!

originalText.text: Milan helped me prepare for the LSAT in 2012.  He was incredibly flexible with scheduling, a true expert in material, and affordable in a way most prep courses of equal caliber are not.  I received one-on-one attention and feedback and it really paid off.  I didn't have the best undergrad GPA, but with the LSAT score secured through prep with Milan, I was offered a decent scholarship to attend law school.  My goal for the LSAT/law school was to practice public interest law.  I am happy to report that I am now a supervisor in a tenants' rights unit at a nonprofit organization in Brooklyn.  I could not be where I am today if it weren't for Milan's study prep and advice throughout the law school application process.  Thank you, Milan!!
